column4: hey guys. what happens if you accidentally copy a file into a directory like
cp foo.dat /etc/bar
what happens to the /etc/bar directory?
not much, if the file exists and you copy over it, it could cause issues. Writing to folders outside $HOME will require sudo
i was using sudo, yeah - thankfully i don't think it overwrote anything though
you can check with:  dpkg -S filename
it says file not found, so i must've done something wrong anyway :P i can't even get my commands wrong properly
if it wasnt found then its not part of a package :D, all is well
excellent, thanks ;)
rc.local will run as root before the login screen shows
so that's not the one i want, then... i'm trying to get synergy (a screen sharing-esque tool) to run but i don't think having it before the login is appropriate
then add it in the startup apps in the applications -> preferences (or admin, not sure0
ah, okay, thanks. i was hoping for a command line way but i'll hunt for the program
you can create a .desktop file in ~/.config/autostart   and it will run in any DE
xorg will give the gui and use the nvidia driver, so you will have both
what is the output of: lsb_release -d
whoops! didn't see you reply
lsb_release -d gives me 11.04 :P
are there any bugs reported?
you can create .desktop files and drag them to dash.
cool, thanks. i'll look into that. seems like the kind of thing that should be possible for 12.04 though - dragging from firefox URL to launcher and the website favicon used as an icon. :)
